column3: Global surface temperature change relative to 1850-1900 from observations and CMIP6 models (human and natural forcings simulations)
Data is for the black, brown and green lines as well as brown and green shadings in panel (b) of SPM1 Figure in the IPCC Working Group I Contribution to the Sixth Assessment Report: SPM
Global Surface Temperature Anomalies (GSTA) is computed from CMIP6 models ensemble (historical-ssp245 and hist-nat experiments) and HadCRUT4.6 observations
Global Surface Temperature Anomalies (GSTA) relative to 1850-1900 from CMIP6 simulations with human and natural forcing (mean over ensamble)
Global Surface Temperature Anomalies (GSTA) anomalies relative to 1850-1900 from CMIP6 simulations with human and natural forcing (5% range over ensamble)
Global Surface Temperature Anomalies (GSTA) anomalies relative to 1850-1900 from CMIP6 simulations with human and natural forcing (95% range over ensamble)
Global Surface Temperature Anomalies (GSTA) relative to 1850-1900 from CMIP6 simulations with natural forcing only (mean over ensamble)
Global Surface Temperature Anomalies (GSTA) relative to 1850-1900 from CMIP6 simulations with natural forcing only (5% range over ensamble)
Global Surface Temperature Anomalies (GSTA) relative to 1850-1900 from CMIP6 simulations with natural forcing only (95% range over ensamble)
Global Surface Temperature Anomalies (GSTA) relative to 1850-1900 from HadCRUT4.6 observations
